intro: Chrysosplenium alpinum, commonly known as alpine chrysosplenium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing habit and dense, mat-forming structure. The plant features small, usually green or reddish leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Chrysosplenium alpinum thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine tundra and rocky habitats.
